info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 5:19PM CDT until April 6 at 2:12AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, The creek reaches bankfull levels in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. High stages on small feeder streams could further result in greater-than-bankfull overflows to mainstem bottomlands. Croplands... pastures... and some secondary rural roads along and near Clear Boggy Creek are affected.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 25.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 26.0 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 26.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage later this evening. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY
